Title: Technical Program Manager
RoleDescription:
Peloton is seeking an experienced Technical Program Manager to help drive collaboration and timely execution of organizational priorities for our Software Product Team. This role will work closely with engineering management, product management and design operations to execute against member-facing software experiences  including but not limited to the software on the Peloton Bike/Bike+, the Peloton Tread/Tread+, and the Peloton Row.
You will be responsible for delivering cross-functional features and technical initiatives, as well as planning requirements, driving alignment between multiple teams, managing schedules, identifying and tracking risks, and clearly communicating to project stakeholders.

Must be an excellent communicator with ability to translate complex technical issues or ideas to a wide non-technical audience

Excellent analytical, problem solving, and planning skills

Motivated, proactive, and demonstrates ownership

Title: SOX ITGC (UAR) Manager
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
We are seeking a skilled SOX ITGC Manager to lead our Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) compliance efforts with a particular focus on User Access Review (UAR) controls and Identity Governance. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in IT general controls, risk management, and identity management frameworks. This role will be responsible for overseeing and managing the execution of the SOX User Access Review process to ensure compliance with Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) regulations and company policies. This role requires a strong understanding of information security principles, regulatory requirements, and the ability to collaborate with external auditors, internal audit teams, and business leaders to ensure robust compliance with SOX controls and effective management of user access reviews. The ideal candidate will possess a strong background in SOX compliance, audit management, and cross-functional collaboration.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

SOX Compliance Management:Oversee and manage SOX compliance activities related to IT General Controls (ITGC), ensuring timely execution of UAR and other related controls.
User Access Review (UAR):Design, implement, and monitor UAR processes to ensure that user access is appropriate and complies with organizational policies and regulatory requirements.
Identity Governance:Develop and maintain an identity governance framework to manage user identities, roles, and access rights across systems, ensuring least privilege access principles are adhered to.
Risk Assessment:Conduct regular risk assessments related to ITGC and identity management. Identify potential risks and recommend mitigation strategies to senior management.
Documentation and Reporting:Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for all SOX controls, including policies, procedures, and process flows. Prepare and present regular compliance reports to management and auditors.
Collaboration:Work closely with IT teams, internal audit, and external auditors to facilitate audits and ensure compliance with SOX requirements.
Interface with External Auditors:Serve as the primary point of contact for external auditors regarding ITGC and UAR controls, ensuring that all necessary documentation and information are provided in a timely manner.
Training and Awareness:Develop training programs for staff on SOX compliance, UAR controls, and best practices in identity governance to foster a culture of compliance within the organization.
Continuous Improvement:Identify opportunities for process improvements in compliance practices and implement best practices in identity governance.

Qualifications:

Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Accounting, or a related experience.
Minimum of 8 years of experience in IT compliance, risk management, or audit, with a focus on SOX.
Proficient in ITGC frameworks, SOX requirements, and UAR controls.
Experience with UAR identity governance tools (Sailpoint, CyberArk)
Familiarity with relevant regulations (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA) and industry standards (e.g., ISO 27001).
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and organizational skills.
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to present complex information clearly.
Relevant certifications (e.g., CISA, CISSP, CRISC) are a plus

Title: Showroom Manager
RoleDescription:
About the Role
As a Store Manager at Peloton, youll drive revenue growth, brand awareness, and community engagement in our dynamic, lifestyle-focused retail spaces.  Whether in a high-traffic Micro location or a more intimate Inline Store setting, success requires strong sales acumen, strategic leadership, and a passion for grassroots Marketing.  Youll lead a lean, high-energy team, maximizing every interaction - converting walk-by traffic and creating demand, all while building meaningful relationships with new and existing Peloton Members.
Your Daily Impact at Peloton 
Sales Leadership & Performance

Own and drive store performance to achieve and exceed sales targets through hands-on leadership.
Develop and execute agile, high-impact sales strategies tailored for dynamic, lifestyle-focused retail spaces. Maximize conversion rates and gross margin % by engaging customers with compelling, consultative sales techniques.
Lead from the frontdemonstrate best-in-class customer interactions and close sales on the floor.
Manage the Profit and Loss statement with precision, using financial insights to drive profitability and strategic decision-making.

Local Demand Creation & Brand Building

Build strong local awareness through grassroots marketing, pop-up activations, and experiential retail strategies.
Establish and maintain partnerships with local wellness communities, influencers, and businesses.
Partner with local Mall Marketing teams to explore relevant opportunities including marketing placement and partnering in like-minded events.
Drive foot traffic through creative event planning, outreach campaigns, and on-site engagement tactics.
Position the store as a hub for the local fitness community, increasing Peloton brand affinity beyond the retail space.

Team Development & Operations

Recruit, train, and develop a results-driven team that thrives in high-energy, interactive selling environments.
Foster a performance-driven, customer-first culture focused on engagement, enthusiasm, and expertise.
Manage store operations, visual merchandising, and inventory flow with a sharp focus on efficiency and impact.

RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
The Sr. Program Manager - Product Safety/regulatory is a critical in the Product Safety Team within Pelotons Quality & Safety organization. Reporting to the Sr. Director, Technical Product Safety, this role will partner with cross-functional teams in executing Pelotons product safety policies. Experience working with CRM tools such as salesforce, data mining tools such looker, Tableau

As the Facilities Technician at Peloton, you will serve as the onsite lead for all facilities-related operations. Title: Data Scientist, Product Analytics
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
Peloton is seeking a Data Scientist on the Product Analytics team to support the innovation, iteration, and optimization of our engagement products! This Data Scientist, Product will work as part of a cross-functional team of Product Managers, Engineers, Designers, and User Researchers to better understand how members are interacting with Peloton products and to inform and evaluate new features and experiences developed by the Product team. 
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON 


Own analytics for one core workstream on Peloton digital apps, from metrics definition and data instrumentation design to ongoing reporting, investigation, and generative research 


Be a key contributor to strategic decisions and roadmap formation for workstream


Collaborate with Product Managers, User Researchers, Designers, and Engineers to lead experimentation processes: designing and measuring A/B tests that help us understand the impact of new/alternate versions of features on user behavior


Define and own reporting and interpretation of KPIs & metrics for workstream, feature launches and A/B tests


Develop a deep understanding of user personas, fitness routines, and retention drivers for our members


Evaluate engagement trends across markets - compare workout/content engagement and feature usage among members within our growing global community


Become an authority on your workstream: provide insight into behaviors and difficulties of members on their journey from app download through sustained long-term engagement; help guide roadmap and evaluation of new features to enhance this user journey


Work in a lean and agile way, focusing on team members' desired outcomes over granular tasks and continuously assessing tradeoffs between precision and action-ability


YOU BRING TO PELOTON


BA/BS degree, preferably in a technical field


Have 3+ years of overall experience in an analytics capacity with a focus on problem-solving and providing concrete insights; some experience conducting analysis with a product/UX focus is desirable (an advanced degree may supply to years of experience)


Have solid technical skills when it comes to data wrangling and handling large datasets: can use SQL for data extraction (including sophisticated joins, CTE, window functions and query optimization), and have a proven understanding of Python syntax required for data cleaning and exploratory analysis (e.g. pandas, numpy)


Have experience with A/B testing and have demonstrated experience designing and assessing experiments


Have an understanding of statistics and data science methodologies (e.g. hypothesis testing, regressions, and other machine learning techniques such as clustering)


Have shown experience defining and owning project success metrics


Have a passion for data storytelling via decks and dashboards and a shown ability to efficiently communicate your insights to non-technical audiences and senior leadership


Are comfortable leading your project timelines, prioritizing tasks with user and business impact in mind, assessing speed/precision tradeoffs, and proactively communicating project statuses to collaborators and teammates


Work well collaboratively, both in a cross-functional context - with Product Managers, Project Managers, User Researchers, Designers, and Engineers - and as a part of joint research projects with Product Analytics teammates


Are curious and humble: ask good questions, are always excited to learn new methods, approaches, and perspectives, and are eager to investigate interesting trends in the data 




Previous experience working on a product analytics team for a B2C software or software+hardware product


Solid understanding of event-based data collection and related technical concepts (e.g. SDK, device vs. cloud mode, schema management) and tools (e.g. Segment)


Experience with product analytics SaaS tools (e.g. Amplitude, Mixpanel, Pendo, etc.)


Experience with social engagement features/products, growth loops, network effects and product virality 


Understanding of adjacent quantitative and qualitative research methods and techniques (e.g. usability testing, concept testing, market sizing, etc.)

Title: Director, Membership Retention
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE 
Peloton is looking for a Director of Membership Retention who will play a key role in reducing churn and improving member engagement. Reporting to the Senior Director, Membership Strategy & Engagement, this leadership role will focus on driving and optimizing member retention strategies, improving member satisfaction, and ensuring alignment with broader business goals. You will lead a team that focuses on implementing effective initiatives to engage members at every touchpoint, using data-driven insights to cultivate long-term loyalty and reduce churn. If you are passionate about lifecycle marketing, member engagement, and retention, and have experience implementing large-scale strategies, we encourage you to apply.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Create and lead data-driven, member-centric strategies to reduce hard churn, soft churn, and membership pauses. Ensure these strategies align with overarching business goals and deliver measurable results in membership retention.
Identify and capitalize on new business opportunities, partnerships, and revenue streams that can improve member engagement, enhance member value, and reduce long-term churn.
Partner closely with key team members in Product, PMM (Product Marketing), Analytics, FP&A, Creative, Content, and Acquisition to develop and implement integrated retention strategies. Ensure retention efforts are aligned with product features, member insights, and overall business objectives.
Responsible for efforts to deepen understanding of member behaviors, preferences, and pain points. Use this knowledge to advise pre-churn tactics and proactively delight existing members, creating strategies to exceed member expectations and increase satisfaction.
Lead efforts specific to member churn reduction, primarily, but not limited to: Re-engagement of inactive members Machine learning-based churn risk profiling Optimization of cancellation and pause reactivation processes Addressing payment failure and soft churn
Own and optimize critical communication channels to engage members, including Email, SMS, Push Notifications, and HW notifications. Work closely with Creative and Content teams to ensure messaging is personalized, timely, and relevant.
Promote a culture of experimentation within the team, always testing and optimizing retention strategies. Use data-driven insights to refine messaging, targeting, and engagement tactics across channels.
Monitor, analyze, and report on campaign performance regularly. Utilize performance data to identify trends, opportunities, and areas of improvement.
Develop actionable insights to continually refine and improve future campaign strategies.
Lead and mentor a high-performing team of direct reports, providing guidance, feedback, and career development opportunities. Establish clear objectives for the team, ensure they are accountable to performance goals, and support professional growth.
Develop, prioritize, and lead long-term retention strategies, aligning with broader company initiatives. Develop clear, actionable roadmaps that result in measurable progress in member retention.

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

10+ years of experience in retention marketing, lifecycle/CRM roles, or similar, with a track record of leading comprehensive campaigns across digital channels such as email, SMS, and push notifications.
6+ years of experience leading and mentoring teams, including managing and guiding direct reports to meet strategic objectives and improve performance.
Familiarity with the subscription business model and deep understanding of the customer lifecycle. Extensive experience within the retention space.
Production and implementation of direct marketing programs across digital channels - email, SMS, in-app, push notifications. Experience with a physical hardware product a plus.
Proficient understanding of marketing automation platforms like Braze, Salesforce, Litmus, or similar tools. Proficiency in HTML and a deep understanding of best practices in email and digital design.
Solid understanding of data analytics tools (Google Analytics, Tableau, Excel, etc.) and ability to analyze campaign performance, derive insights from data, and adapt strategies to optimize results.
Exceptional attention to detail and a meticulous approach to measuring and improving marketing performance.
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills with the ability to clearly present findings and recommendations to senior leadership and other key team members. 
Effective interpersonal skills with a collaborative, team-oriented approach to working across functions.
Experience leading and inspiring a cross-functional team in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. Demonstrated experience managing and developing a team, including mentoring junior and mid-level team members and planning for their professional growth.
Ability to navigate and influence partners at all levels of the organization, driving alignment around shared goals.

ABOUT THE ROLE
The Peloton Treasury Team is looking for a talented treasury professional to join our team! The ideal candidate is a self-starter, analytical, attentive to detail, and highly organized. Moreover, the candidate is someone who consistently exceeds expectations and excels in quantitative and qualitative analytics. The Associate will support Pelotons banking activities, liquidity management and analytics, capital market reporting, maintenance of procedures, and support ad-hoc Treasury projects. Title: Manager, IT SOX and Risk Assurance
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLEWe are looking for a highly motivated, strategic and solution-focused candidate to join our growing SOX and Risk Assurance team. In this role, you will support Pelotons global IT control environment and support the execution of our IT SOX program, helping to drive forward a culture of compliance, integrity and continuous improvement across the organization. The ideal candidate is passionate about IT risk management, thrives working collaboratively in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, and uses their creativity to inspire new ways of working and problem solving. You will serve as a trusted business partner and the connective tissue between the business, internal audit, and our external auditors, demonstrating your technical and internal controls expertise to help us continually assess and manage risks in the IT environment while also supporting business objectives. An ability to think critically and execute effectively while collaborating with business partners and control owners across the organization will be key to success in this role. This position will report to the Senior Manager of IT SOX and Risk Assurance as part of our Finance organization, and be based out of our New York HQ on a hybrid work basis.
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Work within the Second Line of Defense (SOX) team, acting as an advisor to the IT and driving the design, implementation and monitoring of Peloton's risk and control framework
Lead and manage the execution of the IT SOX program, including the monitoring, application and reporting of IT General (ITGC) controls, IT Application (ITAC) controls, and key reports in accordance with SOX 404 requirements and corporate standards.
Analyze processes, risks, and controls related to the IT environment to identify improvement opportunities, recommend solutions that are pragmatic and achievable, and partner with management to resolve deficiencies.
Identify and drive opportunities for automation and using data analytics within the audit process to gain efficiencies and increase audit effectiveness; cohesively bridge the gap between upstream and downstream processes by increasing reliance on key systems and reports.
Perform comprehensive IT risk assessments to identify potential compliance risks and vulnerabilities. Develop and implement risk mitigation strategies to address any identified risks.
Evaluate new system implementations for control considerations, and partner with system owners to ensure appropriate IT controls are designed and in place prior to the systems go live.
Assist IT business partners and GRC team with user access reviews, monitoring controls, and SOC report assessments including providing guidance and recommendations to ensure compliance with corporate standards and SOX requirements.
Provide IT expertise and support on various special projects and company-wide initiatives, ensuring compliance with relevant regulations and standards, including assisting in the development and implementation of IT policies and procedures to support business objectives.
Understand the importance of implementing emerging technologies into Pelotons ecosystem such as AI and ML while also being cognizant of their inherent risks.
Develop and deliver high quality and engaging training programs for control owners and other stakeholders to support their understanding and compliance with SOX requirements.
Collaborate with internal and external auditors to facilitate SOX audits and ensure timely completion and resolution of issues.
Prepare and present executive level communications on IT SOX and Compliance workstreams, including SOX Steering Committee and Audit Committee updates and recommendations.
Stay current with industry best practices, regulatory changes, and emerging trends in IT compliance
Proactively identify areas of improvement on an ongoing basis, providing guidance on best practices and offering actionable recommendations for process changes and potential solutions to drive efficiency and/or mitigate risk.

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

5+ years of relevant IT audit and SOX experience, with a mix of private and public accounting experience preferred
BA/BS degree with an emphasis on Computer Science, or its equivalent; CISA certification preferred
In-depth knowledge of SOX requirements, IT controls, and risk management, and proven expertise in designing and implementing SOX ITGCs, along with robust monitoring and reporting experience for ongoing compliance.
Experienced in working with modern cloud Software as a Service (SaaS), Platform as a Service (PaaS), and agile environments; ability to adapt to ever changing system &amp; process landscape
Experience with NetSuite and SAP ERP systems preferred; understanding of core coding languages (e.g. SQL, Python) a plus.
Organized with strong project management skills, including effective consultation, coordination across multiple stakeholders/teams, prioritization of issues and organization
Outstanding communicator with keen ability to present findings in a succinct manner and tailor messaging as appropriate across a range of audiences
Ownership mentality; results-driven, self-starter, resourceful and comfortable with ambiguity
Superior problem-solving skills and ability to manage competing priorities and deadlines.
Ability to operate at both a strategic and execution level; ideate and directly execute.
 Positive outlook, intellectually curious, desire to continually learn and grow, team player.

ABOUT THE ROLE
Peloton's Content Department is a dynamic and collaborative team dedicated to delivering world-class subscription content to our members every day. As a Senior Media Operations Technician, you will play a critical hands-on role in the execution and support of Media and post-production operations for our global content pipeline.
You will be deeply embedded in media management, content management, quality control (QC), and delivery workflows, serving as a key connector between pre-production, production, post-production, and final distribution. This position is ideal for someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment, has a strong technical post-production skill set, and excels at keeping complex content pipelines running smoothly.
 
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Actively manage and contribute to all stages of post-production workflows, from ingest through final delivery.
Identify, troubleshoot, and resolve issues in On-Demand and Banked Content to maintain content quality and publishing standards.
Perform hands-on editing, audio mastering, graphics integration, and color correction across a wide range of deliverables.
Review content from rough cut to final file delivery, providing quality-control feedback at multiple stages.
Execute media QC, ensuring that assets meet Pelotons technical specifications, file naming conventions, and organizational standards.
Organize, catalog, and maintain media assets across platforms and content management databases (CMS and MAM systems).
Handle direct file deliveries and manage asset movement, supporting seamless distribution to stakeholders and platforms.
Collaborate closely with Production, Post-Production teams, and Vendors to ensure timelines, technical needs, and deliverables are met.
Contribute to continuous improvement efforts by providing workflow insights and suggesting operational efficiencies.
Address and manage post-production support requests from Content, Production, and Product teams.

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

3 to 4+ years of post-production/Media Operations experience needed 
Strong hands-on experience managing end-to-end post-production workflows.
Proven ability to handle video editing, audio mixing, motion graphics, and color correction independently.
Deep familiarity with media QC practices, technical standards, codecs, frame rates, color spaces, and delivery pipelines.
Proficiency with Pro Tools, Davinci Resolve, and Adobe Creative Suite (Premiere, After Effects, Photoshop, Lightroom).
Experience working with content management systems (CMS) and media asset management (MAM) platforms.
Excellent organizational skills, attention to detail, and ability to prioritize in a fast-paced, high-volume environment.
Strong cross-functional communication skills to work effectively with Production, Creative, and Product teams.
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously, meeting deadlines with minimal supervision.
Flexible availability, including early mornings, evenings, and weekends,and public holidays as needed.
Working knowledge of naming conventions, metadata tagging, and media archival best practices.
Proficiency in German or Spanish is a plus (but not required).

Title: Director, Marketing Measurement Strategy
RoleDescription:
ABOUT THE ROLE
Peloton is seeking an experienced Marketing Analytics professional to lead our Marketing Measurement Strategy team, driving action through data-driven insights. In this highly visible role, you will set the strategic vision for our global marketing measurement framework and investment allocation. The Director, Marketing Measurement Strategy will lead key strategic initiatives, including marketing OKRs, learning agenda and experimentation, and Marketing Mix Modeling (MMM). Success in this role requires expertise in analytics, incrementality testing, and MMM, along with strong leadership and collaboration skills to drive action across all levels of the business. This role will lead a team of two and will report into the Senior Director of Global Marketing Analytics. 
YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Define our measurement framework, including KPI identification, prioritization, and optimization. 
Partner with stakeholders to set OKRs that accurately measure success against strategic priorities. 
Allocate and optimize marketing investment across markets, products, and channels using mix modeling and experimentation. 
Collaborate with key team members to identify critical business questions and translate them into a prioritized global learning agenda supported by measurement methodologies.
Manage expectations regarding timing, capabilities, and the application of tests and analytics methodologies. 
Develop and deliver strategic recommendations and actionable insights to senior leadership. 
Ensure consistency in measurement frameworks across regions while adapting to market-specific nuances in marketing performance and strategy. 
Champion a culture of learning by sharing insights and learnings, driving continuous improvement in marketing effectiveness across teams and regions. 

YOU BRING TO PELOTON

10+ years of experience in marketing analytics, data science, or a related field, with a strong background in testing, measurement, and MMM. 
Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field; Master's degree preferred. 
Proven leadership experience leading teams and driving large-scale analytics initiatives across global regions. 
Expertise in statistical analysis and modeling, with proficiency in tools such as R, Python, or similar.
Advanced communication skills to present complex data insights to both technical and non-technical audiences, including executive leadership. 
Extensive experience with experimental design and incrementality testing methodologies, including (but not limited to) A/B testing, geo-based testing, and pre/post analysis.
Experience working with media platforms such as Google, Meta, and TikTok, with familiarity in their testing and measurement capabilities. 
Effective project management skills to ensure scalability and repeatability of testing frameworks across regions.
Passion for encouraging a data-driven, continuous improvement culture and contributing to the overall strategic direction of marketing initiatives.

Title: Industrial Designer

[ABOUT THE ROLE]Peloton is an award-winning health and fitness brand that builds connected products and experiences that matter. We are currently looking for a passionate Industrial Designer with 5+ years of experience to join our team. In this role, you will lead and support the aesthetic, functional, and usability development of products throughout the development process. Our ideal candidate has a passion for health and fitness and is excited to work closely with our passionate team of designers, engineers, outside vendors, and key business partners to bring ideas to life.
[YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON] End-to-end product development from research and early concept exploration, to product DFM and launch Make design decisions for a product or component and explain how those decisions were made. Use a variety of inputs to stimulate creative thinking, make design proposals and evolve our design language. Communicate your ideas via physical prototypes, sketches, 2D presentations, and CAD - effectively articulate your design ideas to partners across the company. Implement all tasks with high quality - develop, deploy and maintain design intent with limited oversight. Produce work that is free of major technical defects - you are able to debug and fix issues when they arise, mostly independently. Troubleshoot technical challenges with cross-functional partners and vendors to maintain design intent. Actively engage the team in discussions and foster healthy design debates and mediate conversations between functions to help drive toward decisions. Own and drive presenting your work - carefully crafting your presentations based on understanding your target audience. Facilitate brainstorms within your design team to stimulate creative thinking and capture ideas. Simultaneously work across 2+ projects at various stages of development - leading and supporting workstreams as needed. Specify CMF for all user-facing parts and ensure production parts meet design and CMFrequirements[WHAT YOU BRING TO PELOTON] You have a proven understanding of the Product Development Process and are beginning to specialize in one or more areas of design. Your work is complex, requiring a high degree of creative thinking to tackle problems. You lead sophisticated projects with direction from senior design leaders and input from cross-functional partners. You have the ability to self-define relevant parameters to work within; set and prioritize deliverables with appropriate timeframes to meet program + phase objectives. You ask the right questions to help inform and define outcomes and results for yourself and other designers. You have experience bringing analog and digital products to market that meet rigorous ergonomic and usability requirements. You have experience developing small and large-scale mass-produced products that use a variety of manufacturing methods including but not limited to plastic injecting modeling, soft goods, metal stamping, casting, and extrusions. You have a passion for design in all its forms and compelling skills, including the ability to translate brand values into captivating narratives, products, and experiences. Bachelor's Degree in Industrial Design 5+ years of relevant work experience Proficient in Solidworks (working with surface modeling + curvature continuous CAD) Proficient in Keyshot Proficient in Adobe Photoshop & Illustrator Experience using Google Docs, Slides, Sheets (or equivalent)[Preferred] Fitness industry experience Advanced surfacing with Alias, or Rhino Experience working with cross functional team such as ME and EE Personal interest in wellness or fitness
